data.title: Winnipeg Free Press Passages
data.meta_description: BARBARA ANNE STEELE  August 10, 1938 - April 9, 2015  Barbara was born and raised in Winnipeg, attending Gordon Bell High School. She lived...
data.text:
Adjust Text Size: A+ A-

BARBARA ANNE STEELE August 10, 1938 - April 9, 2015 Barbara was born and raised in Winnipeg, attending Gordon Bell High School. She lived and worked in Toronto, Kitchener and Vancouver. For most of her career she was a secretary at the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg. Barbara enjoyed many sports including golf and curling. She volunteered yearly for the Teddy Bear's Picnic. She loved cats, especially her beloved Samantha. Barbara enjoyed spending time with her close friends. Barbara was predeceased by her father, Frederick Roy, mother, Louise, and sister Shirley Carleton (John). She is survived by her brother Murray (Lorraine), daughter Jane Fletcher (John); grandchildren Erika and Jared; nieces Kelley Steele, Kathy Desbiolles, Lynda Talveste; nephews Gary Carleton, Grant Steele; great-nieces Robin Carleton, Kelly Carleton, Lisa Talveste, Ivy Desbiolles; great-nephews Andrew Talveste, Jordan Steele. In keeping with Barbara's wishes, cremation has already taken place and there will be no funeral service. Donations in her name can be made to CancerCare Manitoba or the Winnipeg Humane Society.

Publish Date: May 2, 2015

BARBARA ANNE STEELE Barbara Steele passed away suddenly at home on April 9, 2015. Full obituary to follow.

Publish Date: Apr 16, 2015

As published in Winnipeg Free Press on May 02, 2015
